etymology.description: Pictogram (象形): 氏 (“clan; bowing figure”) + 一; 氏 with an empty circle (then a line, now a line or point) beneath, perhaps a bowing figure sowing or a tree root marked at the bottom.
etymology.interpretation: A depiction of 氏 with a mark below, evoking either a bowed person engaged in sowing or the base of a tree with a mark. This imagery aligns with senses related to “base/foundation” and later provided a phonetic/graphic source for related characters.

examples.chinese: 氐人是中国古代的一个民族(氐人是中國古代的一個民族)。
examples.pinyin: Dīrén shì Zhōngguó gǔdài de yí gè mínzú.
examples.english: The Di were an ancient ethnic group in China.

examples.chinese: 历史文献中常提到氐族在西北的活动(歷史文獻中常提到氐族在西北的活動)。
examples.pinyin: Lìshǐ wénxiàn zhōng cháng tí dào Dīzú zài xīběi de huódòng.
examples.english: Historical texts often mention the activities of the Di people in the northwest.

examples.chinese: 字形像氏下加一点，或指树根之底(字形像氏下加一點，或指樹根之底)。
examples.pinyin: Zìxíng xiàng shì xià jiā yì diǎn, huò zhǐ shùgēn zhī dǐ.
examples.english: The form looks like shi with an added dot below, possibly indicating the base of a tree.
